name: Camel's Hump

trails_config.name: Burrows Trail
trails_config.description: The most direct route to Vermont's only undeveloped 4,000-footer summit. A steady climb through hardwood forest leading to a rocky, alpine cone.
trails_config.parking_info: Burrows Trailhead, Camels Hump Rd, Huntington, VT

trails_config.name: Monroe Trail
trails_config.description: Ascends the eastern face of the mountain. Slightly longer and more scenic than Burrows, featuring better views of the Winooski River valley.
trails_config.parking_info: Monroe Trailhead, Camel's Hump Rd, Duxbury, VT

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of Vermont on Camel's Hump. At 4083 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4083 feet, Camel's Hump is a standout peak in Vermont. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Burrows Trail**, a **4.8 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.
